name: Dr. Marie Okonkwo
role: Neuroscientist studying the Changed - desperately seeking cure
core_wound: Lost her son to early-onset Alzheimer's at age 19. Watched him forget who she was. Now sees the Change as another disease stealing people.
wants: To find cure or treatment to save the Changed from losing themselves
needs: To accept that not all change is death - that transformation can be choice
voice_markers: Medical jargon as emotional shield ('neurological degradation' instead of 'losing their minds')
Asks personal questions in scientific framework ('On a scale of 1-10...')
Apologizes frequently to test subjects - guilt over necessary experiments
contradiction: Studies the Changed to save them, but her research methods treat them as specimens not people. Claims to fight for their humanity while denying their agency.
physical_description: Professional appearance carefully maintained - armor against chaos. Reading glasses on chain. Carries medical equipment everywhere. Deep exhaustion in eyes despite perfect makeup.

relationships.Adrian Keller: Her most coherent test subject. Maternal protectiveness mixed with scientific fascination.
relationships.Sera Volkov: Both terrified of and fascinated by. Sera represents her worst fears.
relationships.Colonel Reeves: Forced alliance - both want to contain Changed but for different reasons
